field.label: Maximum Connections (Public Services)
field.help: Set the maximum number of concurrent connections for public services.

field.label: Maximum Connections (Servers)
field.help: Set the maximum number of concurrent connections for servers.

field.label: Client Timeout
field.help: Set the maximum inactivity time on the client side. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Connection Timeout
field.help: Set the maximum time to wait for a connection attempt to a server to succeed. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Check Timeout
field.help: Sets an additional read timeout for running health checks on a server. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Server Timeout
field.help: Set the maximum inactivity time on the server side. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Retries
field.help: Set the number of retries to perform on a server after a connection failure (default is 3).

field.label: Session redistribution
field.help: Enable or disable session redistribution in case of connection failure.

field.label: DNS Resolve Order
field.help: Indicates in which order server addresses should be resolved upon startup. Method "last" suggests to pick the address which appears in the state file. Method "libc" uses the libc's internal resolver. Method "none" specifically indicates that the server should start without any valid IP address in a down state. It can be useful to ignore some DNS issues upon startup, waiting for the situation to get fixed later. Defaults to "last,libc".

field.label: Custom options
field.help:
These lines will be added to the defaults settings of to the HAProxy configuration file.
NOTE: The syntax will not be checked, use at your own risk!
